irtrusbot

Class IrcSession

  • Object
    • IrcSession

  • public class IrcSession
extends Object
    Class maintaining information and useful actions pertaining to a client session connected to a server.
    Author:
    crashdemons

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      IrcOrigin account
      Origin information about the client/user of the session.
      int port
      Plaintext IRC port used for connection
      int received
      Running count of IRC Commands received during the object lifetime
      int sent
      Running count of IRC Commands sent during the object lifetime
      String server
      IRC Server being connected to

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IrcSession()
      Create an IRC Session instance - specific to one client/user.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean connect()
      Connect to the configured IRC server and port.
      void disconnect()
      QUIT (if possible) and close the current IRC connection
      void identify()
      Sends a Nickserv Identify command, if a password is set.
      boolean isConnected()
      Determine if the session is currently connected to the IRC Server

      Sends the configured user information to the server (for initial connections).
      void loginwait()
      Sends user information and waits for success or failure indicators (001-004 or specific error codes)

      Reads in a single IRC Command (in object form) from the server.

      Read a single IRC Command line of text from the server

      Formats and sends a message (PRIVMSG) [based on message details] to the server

      Creates, Converts, and sends a reply message to an IRC Message object as a PRIVMSG to the server NOTE: this function assumes 'account' to be from/origin field of the reply sent.

    • Field Detail

      • account

        public IrcOrigin account
        Origin information about the client/user of the session. Contains the user's Nickname, Username text, Hostname, and Ident status

      • server

        public String server
        IRC Server being connected to

      • port

        public int port
        Plaintext IRC port used for connection

      • sent

        public int sent
        Running count of IRC Commands sent during the object lifetime

      • received

        public int received
        Running count of IRC Commands received during the object lifetime

    • Constructor Detail

      • IrcSession

        public IrcSession()
        Create an IRC Session instance - specific to one client/user. Multiple instanced may be created (per-connection) as required without issue.

    • Method Detail

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws IOException
        QUIT (if possible) and close the current IRC connection
        Throws:
        IOException - Error occured while sending QUIT or closing socket.

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
                throws UnknownHostException,
                       IOException
        Connect to the configured IRC server and port.
        Returns:
        True: connection successful. False: connection failed.
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException - The hostname could not be found
        IOException - Error occurred while creating socket streams.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Determine if the session is currently connected to the IRC Server
        Returns:
        True: currently connected to server. False: disconnected/not connected to any server.

      • login

        public void login()
           throws IOException
        Sends the configured user information to the server (for initial connections). This includes NICK and USER commands. NOTE: if a password is available, a PASS command will be attempted.
        Throws:
        IOException - Error sending data.

      • loginwait

        public void loginwait()
               throws IOException
        Sends user information and waits for success or failure indicators (001-004 or specific error codes)
        Throws:
        IOException - Error reading or sending data.
        See Also:
        login()

      • identify

        public void identify()
              throws IOException
        Sends a Nickserv Identify command, if a password is set. The exact format used is PRIVMSG NickServ :IDENTIFY passwordhere
        Throws:
        IOException - Error sending data.

      • readRawLine

        public String readRawLine()
                   throws IOException
        Read a single IRC Command line of text from the server
        Returns:
        Connected: Raw IRC Command string | Not Connected: null
        Throws:
        IOException - Error reading data.

      • sendRawLine

        public void sendRawLine(String line)
                 throws IOException
        Send a single IRC Command line of text to the server
        Parameters:
        line - Raw IRC Command string to send
        Throws:
        IOException - Error sending data.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(IrcMessage im)
                 throws IOException
        Converts and sends an IRC Message object as a PRIVMSG to the server.
        Parameters:
        im - IRC Message object
        Throws:
        IOException - Error sending data

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(IrcOrigin from,
               String to,
               String text)
                 throws IOException
        Formats and sends a message (PRIVMSG) [based on message details] to the server
        Parameters:
        from - Origin information for the sender (generally 'account')
        to - Nickname or Channel string for the destination of the message
        text - Message text being sent
        Throws:
        IOException - Error sending data.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(String to,
               String text)
                 throws IOException
        Formats and sends a message (PRIVMSG) [based on message details] to the server. NOTE: this function assumes 'account' to be from/origin field.
        Parameters:
        to - Nickname or Channel string for the destination of the message
        text - Message text being sent
        Throws:
        IOException - Error sending data.
        See Also:
        account

      • sendReply

        public void sendReply(IrcMessage im,
             String text,
             boolean direct)
               throws IOException
        Creates, Converts, and sends a reply message to an IRC Message object as a PRIVMSG to the server NOTE: this function assumes 'account' to be from/origin field of the reply sent.
        Parameters:
        im - IRC Message object being replied-to.
        text - Message text being sent in reply.
        direct - True: Message is sent via private-message to the replyee | False: message will the channel the replyee used, if possible.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • readCommand

        public IrcCommand readCommand()
                       throws IOException
        Reads in a single IRC Command (in object form) from the server. NOTE: Fatal commands automatically force disconnection.
        Returns:
        Success: IRC Command object | Failure: null
        Throws:
        IOException - Error reading data.

      • setConnectionDetails

        public void setConnectionDetails(String sServer,
                        int nPort)
        Set details about the IRC Server to connect to.
        Parameters:
        sServer - Hostname string of the server (domain name)
        nPort - Port to connect to (usually 6667) NOTE: must be plaintext not SASL/SSL/etc.

      • setAccountDetails

        public void setAccountDetails(String nickname,
                     String username,
                     String realname,
                     String password)
        Set user information (transmitted to server on initial connections). This user information is used in login() and identify().
        Parameters:
        nickname -
        username -
        realname -
        password -
        See Also:
        login()
